title: Drawing, "Costume Design for Sir John Evans, for Production of "The Merry Wives of Windsor"", ca. 1927
medium: Graphite, brush and watercolor on illustration board
markings: verso: stamped in blue ink, center: THIS DRAWING IS MY PERSONAL PROPERTY / AND MUST BE RETURNED TO ME / HENRY DREYFUSS / SEP 30 1927 / logo of Scenic Artists Union Local 829;  printed in brown ink, upper left: Drawing Board / City / HP (hot pressed) for pen-and-ink, CP (cold pressed) / Special Surfaces Nos 1 & 2 for Wash Drawings
inscribed:
Inscribed in pen and black ink on off-white wove paper pasted to board, lower right: PRODUCTION OF / THE MERRY WIVES OF WINDSOR / COSTUME FOR SIR JOHN EVANS / PLAYED BY MR. HANNAM CLARK / 1927.
Verso: clockwise from top left: in pen and black ink: 3 / in graphite: White Flannel / in pen and black ink: H. Clark / in graphite: P- - - - - [unable to decipher]
provenance: University of California, Los Angeles; 1973: acquired by Museum
creditline: Gift of University of California, Los Angeles
description: Costume design for a woman; she is dressed in brown garment with double collars and buttons, green hat and grayish shoes. Another figure is in the upper right with less detail.

participants.person_name: University Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Costume Design for Sir John Evans, for Production of "The Merry Wives of Windsor"", ca. 1927.Graphite, brush and watercolor on illustration board. Gift of University of California, Los Angeles. 1973-15-123.
